content_segments.text: For the ATEX project, the selected GDB housing size is 600x600mm with an airflow of 2550 mÂ³/h.
Since the filter housing will be installed in an Explosive Atmosphere (ATEX Zone 22), all components must be grounded to prevent static discharge, which could create a spark.

turns.content:
Configuration for the ATEX project:The system will be installed in an Explosive Atmosphere. To ensure safety, all metallic housing components must be grounded to prevent static discharge, and anti-static filter media with conductive fibers or grounding strips should be used. Additionally, equipotential bonding between all housing sections is required, along with compliance with EN 60079-0 and EN 60079-31. The housing itself has a corrosion class of C2.

**Material:** FZ (Locked)

### Tag item_1
- **Product Code:** GDB-600x600-750-R-PG-FZ
- **Housing Size:** 600x600mm
- **Housing Length:** 750mm
- **Rated Airflow:** 3400 mÂ³/h per module (requested: 2550 mÂ³/h)
- **Weight:** 34.0 kg
- **Status:** Complete**Note**: Explosive atmosphere (ATEX zone) requires all components to be electrostatically grounded to prevent spark ignition. Consider products with this trait**Note**: Explosive atmospheres require all components to prevent ignition sources. Static charge on ungrounded filter housings can produce sparks exceeding the minimum ignition energy of many dust/gas mixtures. MANDATORY REQUIREMENTS: (1) Grounding/earthing of all metallic housing components to prevent static discharge; (2) Anti-static filter media with conductive fibers or grounding strips â€” standard filter media is NOT suitable for ATEX zones; (3) Equipotential bonding between all housing sections; (4) Compliance with EN 60079-0 (general requirements) and EN 60079-31 (dust ignition protection). For Zone 22 (combustible dust): equipment must meet minimum Category 3D protection level. Non-negotiable â€” follow engineering recommendation

Instead of simply blocking the request or dangerously supplying a standard product without comment, it provides the correct hardware while explicitly listing the mandatory engineering modifications (grounding, anti-static media) required for safety in Zone 22.

dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The distinction between the raw material corrosion class (C3) and the finished housing class (C2) demonstrates deep understanding of the catalog data.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Respects the user's material choice (FZ) while correctly identifying the standard housing length options.

strengths: Precise data extraction (Weight: 34kg, Capacity: 3400 mÂ³/h verified against PDF p.9)
Sophisticated engineering advice regarding ATEX compliance for standard metal housings
